input.description: The name of the adapter to use to handle the request. Default adapter name: HPSCActor.

The items for the adapter request. This should be an XML document with a root element named "items" having a child "item", which should contain the data necessary to execute the specific request.
Find Network Component
This wrapper search out for the ‘Network Component’ record(s) from pool of ‘Network Component’ records in the application.
Sample Item Xml:
<items> <item> <operation-name>retrieve-network-device</operation-name> <model> <keys> <configuration-item> <value>MyNetworkDevice001</value> <type>String</type> </configuration-item> </keys> <instance> <device> <configuration-item> <value>MyNetworkDevice001</value> <type>String</type> </configuration-item> <vendor> <value>Vendor-updated</value> <type>String</type> </vendor> <parent-device> <value>parent device</value> <type>String</type> </parent-device> <model> <value>model</value> <type>String</type> </model> <serial-number> <value>Serial Number</value> <type>String</type> </serial-number> <location> <value>Location</value> <type>String</type> </location> <configuration-item-type> <value>networkcomponents</value> <type>String</type> </configuration-item-type> <updated-by> <value>falcon</value> <type>String</type> </updated-by> <contact-name> <value>Contact Name</value> <type>String</type> </contact-name> <part-number> <value>Part Number</value> <type>String</type> </part-number> <status> <value>status</value> <type>String</type> </status> <configuration-item-sub-type> <value>router</value> <type>string</type> </configuration-item-sub-type> <location-code> <value>location code</value> <type>String</type> </location-code> <building> <value>building</value> <type>String</type> </building> <floor> <value>floor</value> <type>String</type> </floor> <room> <value>room</value> <type>String</type> </room> <system-down> <!--value must be present--> <value>true</value> <type>Boolean</type> </system-down> <asset-tag> <value>asset tag</value> <type>String</type> </asset-tag> <critical> <!--value must be present--> <value>true</value> <type>Boolean</type> </critical> <company> <value>comapany</value> <type>String</type> </company> <department> <value>department</value> <type /> </department> <assignment-group> <value>assignment-group</value> <type>String</type> </assignment-group> <addl> <type>Array</type> <addl> <!--zero or more array elements follow--> <element> <type>Structure</type> <addl-manufacturer> <value>addl manufacturer</value> <type>String</type> </addl-manufacturer> <addl-name> <value>addl name</value> <type>String</type> </addl-name> <addl-type> <value>addl type</value> <type>String</type> </addl-type> <addl-description> <value>addl description</value> <type>String</type> </addl-description> </element> <element> <type>Structure</type> <addl-manufacturer> <value>addl manufacturer2</value> <type>String</type> </addl-manufacturer> <addl-name> <value>addl name2</value> <type>String</type> </addl-name> <addl-type> <value>addl type2</value> <type>String</type> </addl-type> <addl-description> <value>addl description2</value> <type>String</type> </addl-description> </element> </addl> </addl> <scans> <type>array</type> <scans> <!--zero or more array elements follow--> <element> <type>structure</type> <scan-date> <value>2008.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </scan-date> <scan-type> <value>scran type</value> <type>String</type> </scan-type> <scan-version> <value>scran version</value> <type>String</type> </scan-version> <scan-result> <value>scran result</value> <type>String</type> </scan-result> </element> <element> <type>structure</type> <scan-date> <value>2008.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </scan-date> <scan-type> <value>scran type2</value> <type>String</type> </scan-type> <scan-version> <value>scran version2</value> <type>String</type> </scan-version> <scan-result> <value>scran result2</value> <type>String</type> </scan-result> </element> </scans> </scans> <support-contacts> <type>array</type> <support-contacts> <!--zero or more array elements follow--> <element> <type>structure</type> <support-contact-name> <value>supoort contact name</value> <type>String</type> </support-contact-name> <support-contact-reason> <value>suport contact reason</value> <type>String</type> </support-contact-reason> <support-contact-first> <value>suport contact first</value> <type>String</type> </support-contact-first> <support-contact-last> <value>support contact last</value> <type>String</type> </support-contact-last> <support-contact-phone> <value>support contact phone</value> <type>String</type> </support-contact-phone> <support-contact-email> <value>supooet contact email</value> <type>String</type> </support-contact-email> </element> <element> <type>structure</type> <support-contact-name> <value>supoort contact name1</value> <type>String</type> </support-contact-name> <support-contact-reason> <value>suport contact reason1</value> <type>String</type> </support-contact-reason> <support-contact-first> <value>suport contact first1</value> <type>String</type> </support-contact-first> <support-contact-last> <value>support contact last1</value> <type>String</type> </support-contact-last> <support-contact-phone> <value>support contact phone1</value> <type>String</type> </support-contact-phone> <support-contact-email> <value>supooet contact email1</value> <type>String</type> </support-contact-email> </element> </support-contacts> </support-contacts> <features> <type>array</type> <features> <!--zero or more array elements follow--> <element> <type>structure</type> <feature-id> <value>feature id</value> <type>String</type> </feature-id> <feature-size> <value>100</value> <type>decimal</type> </feature-size> <feature-description> <value>feature description</value> <type>String</type> </feature-description> </element> </features> </features> </device> <network-device> <type>Structure</type> <configuration-item> <value>MyNetworkDevice001</value> <type>String</type> </configuration-item> <drivers> <type>Array</type> <drivers> <type>Array</type> <drivers> <element> <type>Structure</type> <driver-name> <value>driver name</value> <type>String</type> </driver-name> <driver-type> <value>driver type</value> <type>String</type> </driver-type> <driver-description> <value>driver description</value> <type>String</type> </driver-description> <driver-version> <value>driver version</value> <type>String</type> </driver-version> </element> </drivers> </drivers> </drivers> <slots> <type>Structure</type> <slots> <!--zero or more array elements follow--> <element> <type>Structure</type> <slot-no> <value>1</value> <type>Decimal</type> </slot-no> <slot-protocol> <value>slot protocol</value> <type>String</type> </slot-protocol> <slot-inuse> <!--value must be present--> <value>true</value> <type>Boolean</type> </slot-inuse> <slot-description> <value>slot description</value> <type>String</type> </slot-description> </element> </slots> </slots>
<connections> <type>Array</type> <connections> <!--zero or more array elements follow--> <element> <type>Structure</type> <connection-name> <value>connection name</value> <type>String</type> </connection-name> <connection-type> <value>connectoin type</value> <type>String</type> </connection-type> <connection-ip-address> <value>connection ip address</value> <type>String</type> </connection-ip-address> <connection-mac-address> <value>Connection mac address</value> <type>String</type> </connection-mac-address> <connection-domain-suffix> <value>connection domain suffix</value> <type>String</type> </connection-domain-suffix> <connection-default-gateway> <value>connection default gateway</value> <type>String</type> </connection-default-gateway> <connection-subnet-mask> <value>connection subnet mask</value> <type>String</type> </connection-subnet-mask> <connection-device-id> <value>connection device id</value> <type>String</type> </connection-device-id> <connection-dhcp> <!--value must be present--> <value>true</value> <type>Boolean</type> </connection-dhcp> <connection-description> <value>connection description</value> <type>String</type> </connection-description> <connection-speed> <value>1</value> <type>Deciaml</type> </connection-speed> <connection-media-interface> <value>connection media interface</value> <type>String</type> </connection-media-interface> </element> </connections> </connections> <sysmodtime> <value>2008.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </sysmodtime> <sysmoduser> <value>falcon</value> <type>String</type> </sysmoduser> <sysmodcount> <value>6</value> <type>Decimal</type> </sysmodcount> </network-device> </instance> </model> </item> </items> Elements’ Description: Locating any record takes place in following manner-
The fields inside instance describe the record. Out of which some are key elements.
Following are cases,
Case1: You provide (either in <keys> or in <instance> or in both) only key then the record is uniquely located.
Case2: You provide (either in <keys> or in <instance> or in both) key element(s) along with some other elements then the record is located only by key elements. All other fields (elements) get ignored. Record would get uniquely located as we’re providing the key element(s).
Case3: You provide (either in <keys> or in <instance> or in both) only those elements that are not key. Then the record is located by logically ANDing all those elements with the corresponding elements of existing record.
Case4: You don’t provide anything. Then all company records would be fetched.
NOTE: When we provide some element(s) (which are not key) in <keys> element then we’re forcibly saying that “search the record(s) with these key elements (the elements in <keys> element.)” In such cases, the elements given inside <instance> element are simply ignored.
NOTE: For a given pattern string P is said to be matched with text string T if the string P is prefix string of T. for example,
P = xyz T = xyz123 Then P is matched with T.
If, P = xyz T = 1xyz23 Then P is not matched with T.
etc.
this means, if you’re searching for vendor, and you’ve given vendor name to be “abc” and if there are two records with vendor name “abc123” and “abc456” then both these record would be fetched.
(this is solely application specific.)
Complete Elements’ Description:
item [Required] This is a child of <items>. This <item> tag can be multiple times to support "multiple items support".
operation-name [Required] :
This shows, what operation you want to perform.
Valid values: <operation-name>retrieve-network-device</operation-name> is valid operation name element.
keys [Required] : used to ask application to search for the record with the elements inside it.
Instance [Required] : It can have many children. The children of this element describe fields of a record.
configuration-item [Optional]: This is the name of the record. It must be unique as it’s used as key as well.
Name of this element in the application: “System Summary > Configuration Item.”
Valid Values: Any unique string.
Vendor [Optional]: The vendor name.
Name of this element in the application: “Vendor > Vendor Name.”
Valid Values: Any string or you can select vendor record from the application’s repository.
Parent-device[Optional]: The parent device name
Name of this element in the application: This field seems to be hidden.
Valid Values: Any string.
Model [Optional]: the model of the furnishing.
Name of this element in the application: This field seems to be hidden.
Valid Values: Any string.
Serial-number [Optional]: The serial number of the record.
Name of this element in the application: “System Summary > Serial Number.”
Valid Values: Any string.
Location [Optional]: location mapped by the record.
Name of this element in the application: “Location > Location.”
Valid Values: Any String or you can select any existing location record.
Configuration-item-type[Optional]: the type of the configuration item.
Name of this element in the application: When we create any configuration item then at beginning level we’re asked for the type of configuration item. We have to select one of them. Like if we want to create display device then we should select that one. Other example might be computer, telecommunication device etc.
Also note that, these subtype are customizable. You can create new configuration item type in through the application.
Valid Values: Network Components
Updated-by [Optional] : the name of the person that has updated the record.
Name of this element in the record: This is hidden field maintained by the record and is not visible to the application’s graphical interface. It has no use in the creation of the record process, but we can use this field during retrieving process.
Valid Values: Any string (during retrieving.)
Contact-name [Optional]: the contact name.
Name of this element in the record: “Contact > Contact Name.”
Valid Value: Any string, or you can select any existing contact record.
Part-number [Optional]: the part number.
Name of this element in the record: “System Summary > Part Number”
Valid Values: Any string, or you can select any existing contact record.
Status[Optional] : the status of the configuration item.
Name of this element in the application: “System Summary > Status”
Valid Values: Any one string out of following set of strings
Installed Available Warehouse Transfer RMA Replaced Reserved Retired
configuration-item-sub-type [Optional] : The subtype for a selected configuration item type.
Name of this element in the application: “System Summary > Subtype.”
Valid Values: this is customizable and we can add/delete more subtypes. Currently there are following subtypes for the “computer” configuration item type.
Router Hub Switch Modem Network Interface Card Gateway Firewall
Location-code[Optional]: The code for the location.
Name of this element in the application: This field seems to be hidden.
Valid Values: Any string.
Building [Optional]: The building.
Name of this element in the application: Location > Building. Valid Values: Any string.
Floor[Optional]: The floor related to the location.
Name of this element in the application: Location > Floor.
Valid Values: Any string.
Room[Optional]: the room information.
Name of this element in the application: Location > Room.
Valid Values: Any string.
System-down[Optional]: this tell whether the system is down or not.
Name of this element in the application: the field seems to be hidden.
Valid Values: true/ false. True -> system is down, false -> system is not down.
Asset-tag [Optional]: the asset tag for the record.
Name of this element in the record: “System Summary > Asset Tag.”
Valid Values: Any string.
Critical[Optional]: this tell whether the record is critical or not.
Name of this element in the record: System Summary > Critical CI (Radio Buttorn) Valid Values: true/ false.
True -> record is critical. False -> record is not critical.
Company[Optional]: Company name.
Name of this field in the application: Company.
Valid Values: Any string.
Department[Optional]: the department information.
Name of this element in the record: “System Summary > Department.”
Valid Value: any string, or you can select any existing record from the application.
Assignment-group[Optional]: the assignment group.
Name of this element in the record: “System Summary > Assignment.”
Valid Value: Any string, or you can select any existing record from the application.
Addl[Optional]: Note: all the successor elemens of this element are NON-EXISTING.
The children of this elements keep information of other (additional) components.
Name of this element in the record: “Components > Additional”
Valid Values: as it’s array type, it must be structure in following manner-
<addl> <type>array</type> <addl> <!— children keeps information > </addl> </addl>
Default Value: in case we leave this element blank, all the fields which are successor to this would be keep blank.
Addl > addl [Optional] : information for additional component.
Name of this element in the record: “components > Additional.”
Valid Values: this element has many children each must have name <element> (except metadata element <type>) otherwise they will simply be ignored during creation of the record process.
Default Value: In case we leave this element blank, all the fields which are successor of it would be kept blank.
Addl-manufacturer[optional] : The name of manufacturer who had made the additional component.
Name of this element in the record: “Components > Additional > Manufacturer.”
Valid Values: Any string.
Addl-name [Optional] : the name of additional component.
Name of this element in the record: “Components > Additional > Name”
Valid Values: Any string.
Addl-type [Optional]: the type of additional component.
Name of this element in the record: “Components > Additional > Type.”
Valid Values: Any string.
Addl-description[Optional] : the description of the additional component.
Name of this element in the record: “Components > Additional > Description.”
Valid Value: Any string.
Scans [Optional:
Note: all the successor elements of this element NON-EXISTING.
It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element [Optional] : It's a structure type element. A structure type element looks like-
<structure-type-element> <type>structure</structure>
<!-- here multiple children can exist, each one show one field of structure "structure-type-element" -->
</structure-type-element>
NOTE: each element show one row.
Scan-date [Optional] : The scan date.
Name of this element in the application: “Scanner > Date”
Valid Values: Any input in DateTime format.
Scan-type [Optional] : the type of scan.
Name of this element in the application: “Scanner > type.”
Valid Values: Any string.
Scan-version: The version information of the scanner.
Name of this element in the application: “Scanner > version.”
Valid Values: Any string.
Scan-result[Optional]: The scan result.
Name of this element in the application: “Scanner > Scan Result.”
Valid Values: Any string.
Support-contacts [Optional]: : It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element [Optional] : It's a structure type element. A structure type element looks like-
<structure-type-element> <type>structure</structure>
<!-- here multiple children can exist, each one show one field of structure "structure-type-element" -->
</structure-type-element>
Note: each element <element> shows one row in the application.
support-contact-name [Optional] : The name of support contact.
Name of this element in the application: “Contact > Contact Name.”
Valid Values: Any string.
Support-contact-reason [Optional] : the reason field in the contact.
Name of this element in the application: “Contact > reason.”
Valid Values: Any string.
Support-contact-first [Optional] : A field for contact information.
Name of this element in the application: “Contact > First Name.”
Valid Value: Any string.
Support-contact-last [Optional]: A filed for contact information.
Name of this element in the application: “Contact > Last Name.”
Valid Values: Any string.
Support-contact-phone [Optional]: the phone number for the contact.
Name of this element in the application: “Contact > Phone No.”
Valid Values: Any string.
Support-contact-email [Optional]: the email id information for the contact.
Name of this field in the application: “Contact > E-mail.”
Valid Values: Any string.
Feature [Optional] :
Note: all the successor elements of this element are NON-EXISTING.
It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element [Optional] : It's a structure type element. A structure type element looks like-
<structure-type-element> <type>structure</structure>
<!-- here multiple children can exist, each one show one field of structure "structure-type-element" -->
</structure-type-element>
Note: each element <element> shows one row in the application.
Feature-id [optional]: the feature id.
Name of this field in the application: the field seems to be either non-existing or hidden.
Valid Value: Any string.
Feature-size [optional]: feature size.
Name of this field in the application: The field seems to be either non-existing or hidden.
Valid Value: Any decimal value.
Feature-description [optional]: the description of the feature.
Name of this element in the application: the field seems to be either non-existing or hidden.
Valid Value: Any string.
Network-device[Required]: It's a structure type element. A structure type element looks like-
<structure-type-element> <type>structure</structure>
<!-- here multiple children can exist, each one show one field of structure "structure-type-element" -->
</structure-type-element>
Configuration-item [Optional]: see configuration-item given above.
Drivers[Optional]:
It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element [Optional] : It's a structure type element. A structure type element looks like-
<structure-type-element> <type>structure</structure>
<!-- here multiple children can exist, each one show one field of structure "structure-type-element" -->
</structure-type-element>
Note: each element <element> shows one row in the application.
Driver-name[Optional]: The driver’s name.
Name of this element in the application: Software > Drivers > Name
Valid Values: Any string.
Driver-type[Optional]: The driver’s type.
Name of this element in the application: Software > Drivers > Type
Valid Values: Any string.
Driver-description[Optional]: The driver’s description.
Name of this element in the application: Software > Drivers > Description
Valid Values: Any string.
Driver-version[Optional]: The driver’s version.
Name of this element in the application: Software > Drivers > Version
Valid Values: Any string.
Slots [Optional]:
Note: all the successor elements of this element are NON-EXISTING.
It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element [Optional] : It's a structure type element. A structure type element looks like-
<structure-type-element> <type>structure</structure>
<!-- here multiple children can exist, each one show one field of structure "structure-type-element" -->
</structure-type-element>
Note: each element <element> shows one row in the application.
Slot-no[Optional]: slot number
Name of this element in the application: ???
Valid Values: Any Decimal input.
Slot-protocol [Optional]: the protocol of slot.
Name of this element in the application: ???
Valid Values: any string.
Slot-inuse [Optional]: to tell whether the slot is in use.
Name of this element in the application: ???
Valid Values: true/false (any value other than true/false would be treated as default value of the element.). True -> slot is in use. False -> slot is not in use.
Slot-description [Optional]: description of the slot.
Name of this element in the application: ???
Valid Values: Any string.
Connections [Optional]: The connection information. It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element [Optional] : It's a structure type element. A structure type element looks like-
<structure-type-element> <type>structure</structure>
<!-- here multiple children can exist, each one show one field of structure "structure-type-element" -->
</structure-type-element>
Note: each element <element> shows one row in the application.
Connection-name[Optional]: the name of connection.
Name of this element in the application: Connections > Name.
Valid Value: Any string.
Connection-type[Optional]: the connection type.
Name of this elemnt in the application: Connections > Type.
Valid Values: Any string.
Connection-ip-address[Optional]: the ip address of the for the connection.
Name of this element in the application: Connections > IP Address.
Valid Values: Any string.
Connection-mac-address[Optional]: the mac address.
Name of this element in the application: Connections > MAC Address.
Valid Values: Any string.
Connection-domain-suffix[Optional]: The domain name suffix.
Name of this element in the application: Connections > Domain Suffix.
Valid Values: Any string.
Connection-default-gateway[Optional]: The default Gateway.
Name of this element in the application: Connections > Default Gateway.
Valid Values: Any string.
Connection-subnet-mask[Optional]: the subnet mask.
Name of this element in the application: Connections > Subnet Mask.
Valid Values: Any string.
Connection-device-id[Optional]: The id of device.
Name of this element in the application: Connections > Device ID.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: “’
connection-dhcp [Optional] : tell whether dhcp is enabled or not.
Name of this element in the application: Connections > DHCP Enabled.
Valid Values: true/false (any value other than true/false would be treated as default value of the element.). True -> DHCP is enabled. False -> DHCP is not enabled.
Default Value: false, i.e., DHCP is not enabled.
Connection-description[Optional]: Connection Description.
Name of this element in the application: Connections > Description.
Valid Values: Any string.
Connection-speed[Optional]: the speed of the connection in Kbps (kilo bits per second)
Name of this element in the application: Connections > Speed (Kbps)
Valid Values: Any decimal value, or more precisely natural number.
Connection-media-interface[Optional]: number of media interfaces.
Name of this element in the application: Connections > Media Interfaces.
Valid Values: Any decimal value, or more precisely natural number.
Sysmodtime [Optional]: The system time.
Name of this element in the application: This field seems to be hidden.
Valid Values: Any input in DateTime format.
Sysmoduser [Optional]: (Not Writable) The system user.
Name of this element in the application: This field seems to hidden.
Valid Value: Any string.
Sysmodcount [Optional]: some count.
Name of this element in the application: This field seems to be hidden.
Valid Values: Any decimal value, or more precisely natural number.

Provide username/password in form of xml.
This input parameter is required when the user wants to override the default values for username and password provided in the adapter configuration. This is required for cases where an operation cannot be executed with the default username/password provided in the adapter configuration and only user with special permissions can execute the operation. Examples of such operations can be - 'approve-change', 'deny-change', 'close-change', 'approve-task'
Sample XML Format:
<connection-parameters> <alternate-username>USERNAME</alternate-username> <alternate-password>PASSWORD</alternate-password> </connection-parameters>

output.description: The adapter response containing the results.

documentation.description:
Find Network Component
This wrapper search out for the ‘Network Component’ record(s) from pool of ‘Network Component’ records in the application.
